description: Test your knowledge of historical events and figures

questions.question: In which year did World War II end?
questions.explanation: World War II ended in 1945 with the surrender of Germany in May and Japan in September.

questions.question: Who was the first President of the United States?
questions.explanation: George Washington served as the first President of the United States from 1789 to 1797.

questions.question: The Great Wall of China was built in the 20th century.
questions.explanation: The Great Wall of China was built over many centuries, with the earliest sections dating back to the 7th century BC.

questions.question: Which ancient civilization built the Machu Picchu complex in Peru?
questions.explanation: Machu Picchu was built by the Inca Empire in the 15th century.

questions.question: Who wrote 'The Communist Manifesto'?
questions.explanation: The Communist Manifesto was written by Karl Marx and Friedrich Engels and published in 1848.

questions.question: Which of the following were ancient Egyptian pharaohs? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Cleopatra, Tutankhamun, and Ramses II were all pharaohs of ancient Egypt. Julius Caesar was a Roman leader, and Alexander the Great was a Macedonian king.

questions.question: Which event marked the beginning of World War I?
options: The assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand
questions.correctAnswer: The assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand
questions.explanation: World War I began after the assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand of Austria in Sarajevo on June 28, 1914.

questions.question: Which city was the capital of the Byzantine Empire?
questions.explanation: Constantinople (modern-day Istanbul) was the capital of the Byzantine Empire from its foundation in 330 CE until its fall in 1453.

questions.question: The Renaissance period primarily began in which country?
questions.explanation: The Renaissance began in Italy in the late 13th century before spreading to the rest of Europe.

questions.question: Who was the leader of the Soviet Union during most of World War II?
questions.explanation: Joseph Stalin was the leader of the Soviet Union from the mid-1920s until his death in 1953, including during World War II.
